# SCNPhysicsShape.Option

**Structure**

Keys for the options dictionary used when creating a physics shape.

## Declaration

```swift
struct Option
```

## Discussion

When SceneKit creates a shape from a hierarchy of nodes containing multiple geometries, the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNPhysicsShape/Option/keepAsCompound] option takes precedence over the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNPhysicsShape/Option/type] option.

For example, if you have a node hierarchy containing several geometries, setting the the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNPhysicsShape/Option/type] option to [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNPhysicsShape/ShapeType/boundingBox] and the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNPhysicsShape/Option/keepAsCompound] option to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] creates a shape that is a combination of several boxes. This approach can provide better simulation performance than converting the entire node hierarchy to a single concave polyhedron shape.

## Type Properties

- **collisionMargin**
- **keepAsCompound**: An option for selecting whether to create a group of independent shapes or combine them into a single shape.
- **scale**: An option for selecting the scale factor of the shape relative to the local coordinate space of the node containing it.
- **type**: An option for selecting the level of detail at which to create shapes from geometry.
- **SCNPhysicsShape.ShapeType**: Values for the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNPhysicsShape/Option/type] key specifying the level of detail that SceneKit uses when creating a physics shape based on a geometry.

## Initializers

- **init(rawValue:)**

- Hashable
- RawRepresentable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
